meanings.definition: A person who amuses others by ridiculous behavior or jokes.
meanings.sent1: The circus clown was a buffoon who made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent2: The party entertainer was a buffoon, bringing joy to all with his funny tricks.
meanings.sent3: The buffoon at the comedy show had the audience in stitches with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: His buffoonery was like a ray of sunshine on a gloomy day, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The buffoon's performance was so memorable that people talked about it for weeks.

meanings.definition: To behave in a ridiculous or comical manner.
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, he decided to buffoon around and make everyone giggle.
meanings.sent2: She loves to buffoon with her friends, always finding ways to make them chuckle.
meanings.sent3: The children buffooned around in the playground, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to buffoon his way out of trouble only made the situation more amusing.
meanings.sent5: The comedian buffooned on stage, leaving the audience roaring with laughter.
